Articles.Content: Is anybody else playing KSP just a little too much right now? I've been getting up at 6 in the morning for the past couple of days just to work on a project I am trying to get through on KSP, and I think the game is actually causing me to get warn out. If I'm not playing KSP at the moment I'm on the forums. Is this bad? Is anyone else going through the same thing? Why am I asking so many questions about something so pointless?

KSP playing has phases.

Phase 0: Game is bought

Phase 1: Game is fairly interesting, learning new things

Phase 2: Game is super fun, trying to do everything

Phase 3: Game starts to become less fun, projects get abandoned

Phase 4: Stop playing game.

Repeat 1-4 throughout.
Nope. There is no such thing as too much KSP.

KSP playing has phases.

Phase 0: Game is bought

Phase 1: Game is fairly interesting, learning new things

Phase 2: Game is super fun, trying to do everything

Phase 3: Game starts to become less fun, projects get abandoned

Phase 4: Stop playing game.

Repeat 1-4 throughout.

Step 5: MOAR MODS !

And then, you repeat step 1-5

Nope. There is no such thing as too much KSP.

Even if I'm drowsy, feeling slightly lightheaded and having my back ache?

Too-Much-KSP

Words do not make sense together.

For me, it's more like this whenever I want to play KSP.

Step 1: Manage mods and MM patches for hours and usually don't get to actually playing the game.

Step 2: Open KLF to see if there's anyone on (usually nobody ) and if there isn't then I usually just do something else (ex: step 1)

Step 3: Open KSP and play career or sandbox for a few hours

Step 4: Game crashes because of memory leaks

Step 5: Decide to either go back to step 2 or step 1 or just stop and do something else.
Lol, Yeah sometimes you can play too much. Just take a break for a month or two. I find I get pulled back by build ideas mostly so I'm never away for long.

Is anybody else playing KSP just a little too much right now? I've been getting up at 6 in the morning for the past couple of days just to work on a project I am trying to get through on KSP, and I think the game is actually causing me to get warn out. If I'm not playing KSP at the moment I'm on the forums. Is this bad? Is anyone else going through the same thing? Why am I asking so many questions about something so pointless?

I am exactly the same as your description. You are certainly not alone

Hah for sure. Too many ideas to stop. And I'd pay someone to keep my pages updated. I have finished craft I just don't have time to make posts for.

I need a marketing department.

Edited August 15, 2015 by clown_baby

Hah for sure. Too many ideas to stop. And I'd pay someone to keep my pages updated. I have finished craft I just don't have time to make posts for.

I need a marketing department.

I'm just trying to make as many things as possible right now... 9 finished (or almost finished) craft made in the past 2-3 days... with so many more still to make before I release them.

KSP playing has phases.

Phase 0: Game is bought

Phase 1: Game is fairly interesting, learning new things

Phase 2: Game is super fun, trying to do everything

Phase 3: Game starts to become less fun, projects get abandoned

Phase 4: Stop playing game.

Repeat 1-4 throughout.

I've been stuck on phase 4 for months now.

I totally do: I didn't played for months (excluding some tests of the new versions) because I've reached a point where I spend hours in the VAB/SPH alone without launching even for a simple project because I want to avoid too much trial and error

don't be silly, "too much ksp" is not a thing

I have been through that "wake up early" phase, and IIRC some days later I have been dreaming of a gracious rover hurdling on duna plains... that night I wake up just after this dream and wondered if it was a good idea to get up and do exactly what I dreamed of. but then I realized that I would have to explain to my girlfriend why I was up in the middle of the night playing ksp...

anyway I am glad I have KSP. this is game really need long term plan and a bit of organisation and rigor if you want to experience the whole thing, which kind of have a good impact on my everyday life.

All hail to Jeb and his colleague, and to SQUAD for this wonderful game

Too .....much .....KSP?

I don't understand
Yeah, I started throwing mods in like crazy and it was rejuvenating.
I generally go through this phase with most games. Currently been playing KSP till 6 AM

Some kind people on this forum tried to have an intervention for me a while ago, but I was able to convince them that KSP was way more important than my job and my girlfriend, so it's all good now!

JR

I have not played in a couple of months. I probally will not play again until the Unity 5 port has been out for a couple months. That should be enough time for the some of the major bugs to be fixed and the modders to release updates.

Here is my cycle:

1) new update comes out and/or I decide to try new mods

2) start a new career

3) go through the initial tech/science/cash bootstrapping

4) get into the phase of "continue to visit Mun/Minmus in order to get science so I can unlock those interesting mod parts"

<At this point my interest lags>

5) Get enough parts unlocked and decide to go to Duna/Ike/Eve/Gilly

6) Entire tech tree is unlocked

<At this point either recycle back to step 1 with new mods or a new update, or walk away from the game for a while, or go on to step 7>

7) Send a manned expedition to Jool.

<At some point around here I just stop for a while, and end up later back at step 1>

When it looks like this and with all the possibilities? I find other games to be no fun now. I gave away my Xbox One to my 9 year old nephew.

Because of the learning curve of RSS, RO, and the look of RVE I can say I'm addicted.

Edited August 16, 2015 by hellblazer
<peeks out> KSP? What's that? <buries head in Factorio>

Heh waiting for new patches at the moment (just lurking around on the forums, not playing the game)

Although, i guess the move to unity 5 will change various building tricks - and we'll have to learn new ones

When (my friend and) I play War Thunder, I can't help but open KSP on another screen and play. Of course, it gradually ends to me being shot down in War Thunder and my friend making fun of me for multitasking with KSP.

I can't help it. I need to play moar, MOAR, MOAAAR!

Whenever I get bored I do one of the following

1. Find new mods and play with them

2. Get a new planets pack

3. If all else fails. I think of one thing I haven't done yet. "I haven't put a rover on Eloo, better do that"
